<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning and welcome to June. </strong>That weekend weather was truly abysmal, but at least it allowed us to catch up on the excellent <em>Mare of Easttown</em>. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEMOGRAPHICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/china-adopts-threechild-policy-rule-boost-population?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China Calls in the Storks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Stork carrying baby" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=452 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cAMfDqovnTpqDhm1OR/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Stork carrying baby" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cAMfDqovnTpqDhm1OR/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, China's government said that couples will be able to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/china-bd12b9c524853f33cca8db3a6930b936?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have a third child</a>, a decision meant to spark more babies in a country where population growth has hit a wall. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Family planning restrictions have existed in China since 1980, when the government<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>instituted a one-child-per-household policy out of fear it wouldn't have the resources to provide for a swelling population. China relaxed that cap to two children in 2015 but, following the pandemic’s baby bust, it's realizing it needs to confront this problem more urgently. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>There were </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-to-ease-limits-on-births-allowing-couples-to-have-three-children-11622447583?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">12 million births</a></span><span> in China in 2020, down 18% annually and the fourth straight year of declines. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Demographers expect the country's population, currently at 1.4 billion, to peak by 2025. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Declining population growth has profound implications for a country's economic success. Fewer babies = fewer future workers. And it could upend existing systems of support for the elderly, because younger workers’ taxes subsidize public services for retirees.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This isn't just a China problem</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A "demographic time bomb" alarm is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/22/world/global-population-shrinking.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">being sounded</a> in dozens of countries.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>South Korea's rate of births per woman </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-05-25/south-korea-is-growing-old-fast-leaving-a-younger-generation-home-alone-and-chi?utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-economics&utm_source=twitter&utm_content=economics&utm_medium=social&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell to 0.84</a></span><span> last year, the lowest in the world. For reference, the "replacement" rate that would keep a population stable is about 2.1. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The US population grew at its </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/america-growth-slowing/2021/05/09/3a4b81ba-b032-11eb-ab4c-986555a1c511_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowest rate</a></span><span> since the Great Depression from 2010–2020, and its birth rate declined for the sixth straight year last year.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Germany doesn't have enough people to fill its cities. It's taken down 330,000 housing units since 2002.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While many parts of the world face stagnant population growth, others are <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ae51b1bf-4c45-4c8b-8e41-16d2112bc549?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making up for it</a>. Africa’s population is set to double by 2050, helping the world grow from 7.8 billion people today to 11 billion by 2100.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>As much as the Chinese government wants to grow the country's share of the world population, it might be fighting a losing battle. The two-child policy didn't lead to more babies, and critics say the three-child rule won't move the needle, either. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/naomi-osaka-highestearning-female-athlete-world-drops-french-open?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Osaka Says No More French Open Press-ure
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/naomi-osaka-highestearning-female-athlete-world-drops-french-open" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="PARIS, FRANCE May 30.  Naomi Osaka of Japan celebrates her victory" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Mjk5L2ZyZW5jaF9vcGVuX3Rlbm5pc19yb2xhbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tim Clayton - Corbis/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, there’s been more back-and-forth than tennis fans are used to. Naomi Osaka, the highest earning female athlete in the world, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/naomi-osaka-withdraws-french-open-citing-anxiety-over-media-interviews-n1269159?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped out</a> of the French Open yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Osaka announced last week that she wouldn’t be doing any press during the tournament, arguing that press conferences were bad for her and other players' mental health.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Sunday, the head honchos of tennis fined her $15k for skipping a post-match news conference, and raised the possibility of suspending her from future Grand Slam tournaments for violating her “contractual media obligations.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other athletes said they respected Osaka’s initial decision to avoid the press, but pointed out that answering questions in front of a hot mic is just part of the job. Tennis legend Billie Jean King <a href="https://twitter.com/BillieJeanKing/status/1399123726239666176?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that professional athletes have a responsibility to talk to the media.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>In her <a href="https://twitter.com/naomiosaka/status/1399422304854188037?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">withdrawal announcement</a> yesterday, Osaka said she needed to take some time away from the court. She acknowledged that she has been struggling with depression since winning the 2018 US Open, when she became the center of attention at 20 years old after defeating Serena Williams.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD & BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/nestl-rethinks-health-strategy-following-leaked-report?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nestlé Decides It's Time for a Lifestyle Change
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/nestl-rethinks-health-strategy-following-leaked-report" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photograph showing a variety of packaged Nestle food products, including frozen pizzas and hot pockets, Stouffer's lasagna and mac 'n cheese, Toll House cookie dough, and Lean Cuisine microwave dinners " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzAwL25lc3RsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/nestle/9155537081/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nestlé frozen and chillled products</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-NC-ND 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/nestle/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nestlé</a>
</div></div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nestlé, the world's biggest food company by sales, has decided to eat healthier, and not just because it took a chance on the expired crab dip yesterday.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An internal presentation reported by the FT found that 63% of Nestlé products <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4c98d410-38b1-4be8-95b2-d029e054f492?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don't meet</a> a "recognized definition of health" (in this case, at least 3.5/5 stars on Australia's health rating system).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The report </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/nestle-under-fire-over-unhealthy-products-working-new-strategy-2021-05-31///?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">didn't count</a></span><span> baby formula, coffee, pet food, or medical nutrition, which account for about half of sales. If it had, that figure would be closer to 28%.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unfortunately for Nestlé's PR team...these stats are more memorable: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>70% of food items, 96% of beverages, and 99% of candy/ice cream products didn't crack a 3.5. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One pepperoni pizza Hot Pocket contains almost 30% of recommended daily sodium intake.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response, Nestlé said it’s updating nutrition standards and its health strategy. Execs said they have made improvements in recent years, including reducing sugars and sodium in products by about 15%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Baby Ruths aren’t going anywhere, though: "Confectionary and chocolate address a deep human need and are going to be here to stay," CEO Mark Schneider said last year.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The all-electric Ford F-150 Lightning with an extended range battery can <a href="https://www.thedrive.com/tech/40695/the-electric-ford-f-150-can-power-your-entire-house-for-three-days-on-a-single-charge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">power your house</a> for three days on a single charge, according to Ford. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"There was just as much a run on guns as on toilet paper in the beginning of the pandemic."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marqueece Harris-Dawson of the LA City Council described the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/29/us/gun-purchases-ownership-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uptick in gun purchases</a> to the NYT in a way we can all relate to. Roughly 20% of all gun buyers in the US last year were first-time owners, and now, 39% of American households own guns, up from 32% in 2016.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/week-ahead-june-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/31/week-ahead-june-1" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bridge in Virginia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Mjk3L2JyaWRnZV9pbl92aXJnaW5pYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may be short, but it is packed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Infrastructure: </strong>This week will be pivotal for the <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-government-and-politics-2829f043cf332e9e61fc5281790d51ec?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big infrastructure proposal</a> President Biden has laid out. Republican lawmakers have countered with a smaller package, and the two sides will try to hammer out a compromise this week. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said if there is no clear direction by June 7, Democrats would try to go it alone because the American people "expect us to do something."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>Speaking of the word “pivotal,” the May jobs report comes out this Friday and will be an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jobs-report-could-be-pivotal-for-federal-reserve-11622383200?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">important indicator</a> for the Fed's future policy direction. April's numbers whiffed, but a better reading for May could give the central bank more justification for winding down pandemic-era stimulus measures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Just a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/28/jobs-report-looms-in-the-week-ahead-as-markets-enter-the-often-weak-month-of-june.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handful of companies</a> will report this week, including Zoom and Lululemon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pride Month starts today.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Today also marks the beginning of the </span><span><a href="https://www.wivb.com/news/noaa-predicts-above-average-2021-atlantic-hurricane-season/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Atlantic hurricane season</a></span><span>, which is expected to be "above average" but not as bad as last year's record-breaking activity.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook's F8 developer conference begins tomorrow.</span></li>
</ul>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=452 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/cAMfDqovnTpqDhm1OR/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Stork carrying baby\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/cAMfDqovnTpqDhm1OR/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, China's government said that couples will be able to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/china-bd12b9c524853f33cca8db3a6930b936?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave a third child\u003c/a\u003e, a decision meant to spark more babies in a country where population growth has hit a wall. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eFamily planning restrictions have existed in China since 1980, when the government\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003einstituted a one-child-per-household policy out of fear it wouldn't have the resources to provide for a swelling population. China relaxed that cap to two children in 2015 but, following the pandemic’s baby bust, it's realizing it needs to confront this problem more urgently. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThere were \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-to-ease-limits-on-births-allowing-couples-to-have-three-children-11622447583?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e12 million births\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in China in 2020, down 18% annually and the fourth straight year of declines. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDemographers expect the country's population, currently at 1.4 billion, to peak by 2025. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eDeclining population growth has profound implications for a country's economic success. Fewer babies = fewer future workers. And it could upend existing systems of support for the elderly, because younger workers’ taxes subsidize public services for retirees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis isn't just a China problem\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA \"demographic time bomb\" alarm is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/22/world/global-population-shrinking.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeing sounded\u003c/a\u003e in dozens of countries.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSouth Korea's rate of births per woman \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-05-25/south-korea-is-growing-old-fast-leaving-a-younger-generation-home-alone-and-chi?utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-economics\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_content=economics\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell to 0.84\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last year, the lowest in the world. For reference, the \"replacement\" rate that would keep a population stable is about 2.1. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe US population grew at its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/america-growth-slowing/2021/05/09/3a4b81ba-b032-11eb-ab4c-986555a1c511_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslowest rate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the Great Depression from 2010–2020, and its birth rate declined for the sixth straight year last year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGermany doesn't have enough people to fill its cities. It's taken down 330,000 housing units since 2002.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile many parts of the world face stagnant population growth, others are \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ae51b1bf-4c45-4c8b-8e41-16d2112bc549?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emaking up for it\u003c/a\u003e. Africa’s population is set to double by 2050, helping the world grow from 7.8 billion people today to 11 billion by 2100.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAs much as the Chinese government wants to grow the country's share of the world population, it might be fighting a losing battle. The two-child policy didn't lead to more babies, and critics say the three-child rule won't move the needle, either. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Naomi Osaka, the highest earning female athlete in the world, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/naomi-osaka-withdraws-french-open-citing-anxiety-over-media-interviews-n1269159?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped out\u003c/a\u003e of the French Open yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eOsaka announced last week that she wouldn’t be doing any press during the tournament, arguing that press conferences were bad for her and other players' mental health.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Sunday, the head honchos of tennis fined her $15k for skipping a post-match news conference, and raised the possibility of suspending her from future Grand Slam tournaments for violating her “contractual media obligations.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther athletes said they respected Osaka’s initial decision to avoid the press, but pointed out that answering questions in front of a hot mic is just part of the job. Tennis legend Billie Jean King \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BillieJeanKing/status/1399123726239666176?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that professional athletes have a responsibility to talk to the media.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIn her \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/naomiosaka/status/1399422304854188037?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewithdrawal announcement\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, Osaka said she needed to take some time away from the court. She acknowledged that she has been struggling with depression since winning the 2018 US Open, when she became the center of attention at 20 years old after defeating Serena style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNestlé, the world's biggest food company by sales, has decided to eat healthier, and not just because it took a chance on the expired href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4c98d410-38b1-4be8-95b2-d029e054f492?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon't meet\u003c/a\u003e a \"recognized definition of health\" (in this case, at least 3.5/5 stars on Australia's health rating system).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe report \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/nestle-under-fire-over-unhealthy-products-working-new-strategy-2021-05-31///?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edidn't count\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e baby formula, coffee, pet food, or medical nutrition, which account for about half of sales. If it had, that figure would be closer to 28%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnfortunately for Nestlé's PR team...these stats are more memorable: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e70% of food items, 96% of beverages, and 99% of candy/ice cream products didn't crack a 3.5. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne pepperoni pizza Hot Pocket contains almost 30% of recommended daily sodium intake.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response, Nestlé said it’s updating nutrition standards and its health strategy. Execs said they have made improvements in recent years, including reducing sugars and sodium in products by about 15%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
